br.span: Due to Governor Jim Justice closing school through April 30, 2020, Pleasants County Schools will continue to

The week of April 6th is “Spring Break” for Pleasants County Schools. However, we will still be providing 5-Day Meal Boxes on both Monday, April 6th and Monday, April 13th, from 11 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.- noon at the same 4 pickup locations. Reminder calls will be going out on Friday and Sunday after 6 p.m.
Digital Learning Plans are now availble. These plans cover work through April 17th.
3rd 9 weeks report cards were mailed home on Friday, March 20th.

If you requested a computer or paper packet from your child’s school, you need to arrange pickup on Wednesday, March 25th from 10:30am-12:00pm at their school of attendance.Pickup Locations:BES – Front Entrance closest to the playgroundSMES – Front Entrance on the playground sidePCMS – Front entrance by the main officeSMHS – Front entrance by the main officeIf you haven’t already done so, please contact your child’s school in regards to their educational plan. This educational plan has been prepared for each child through Friday, April 17th.Thank you for your understanding during this extended school closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The Office of Child Nutrition will be offering Meal Distributions each school day from 11:00 am to 12:00 noon. Please note that to meet state requirements, students must be present to receive meals. Each day a lunch will be provided as well as the next day’s breakfast. This Monday only, each child will be given a breakfast only while we work to adjust our inventory and methods of preparation. At each Meal Distribution site, families are asked to create a “drive-thru” line to accept food through the car window. This will allow us to follow social distancing practices, protecting both our families and employees. Meal Distribution sites will be at the following locations:-Arvilla Community building on Arvilla Road-St. Marys High School- families should go to the back parking lot towards the VoAg Department hallway entering the south entrance and exiting through the north entrance-God’s Glory Church at 7300 Pike Rd St. Marys WV 26170-Pleasants County Middle School- families will follow the student drop off traffic pattern and meals will be handed out near the entrance of the last hallway of Belmont Elementary School-Select Energy located at 7994 South Pleasants HighwayIf your child has any special dietary needs, please call Amanda Mote at 304-488-9471.
The following guidance is provided to ensure a consistent message across our school system.
